chapter_title: 21. If he is secure at all points, be prepared for him. If
claims: If he is secure at all points, be prepared for him.
If he is in superior strength, evade him.
rules: If your opponent is of choleric temper, seek to irritate him. Pretend to be weak, that he may grow arrogant.
If he is taking his ease, give him no rest. If his forces are united, separate them.
Attack him where he is unprepared, appear where you are not expected.
warnings: These military devices, leading to victory, must not be divulged beforehand.
